channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Several large unmarked potholes, 26th February
item.description:
Multiple potholes on the road coming down from Birdlip into Cheltneham, before Greenway Lane. The potholes are not marked with white paint.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A group of 5 potholes on Lypiatt St, 26th February
item.description:
There is a 10 ft by 10ft area with large cracks and 5 potholes of various depths and sizes. They are at the Andover Road end of Lypiatt St at the entrance to Tivoli Mews. There are sizeable rocks scattered around the street that have come from the holes. The problem gets worse when large heaves refuse and recycling vehicles drive in and out of Tivoli Mews

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Hill View Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall in way, 26th February
item.description:
There is a footpath which has been inaccessible for a number of years. We have brought this to the attention of Tewkesbury Borough council and Glos Footpaths in the past but had no luck in getting this reopened. It is the footpath which links Staverton village to Bamfurlong, near Staverton Airport. The old entrance to the path on the Gloucester Road B4063, is approximately where I have dropped the pin on the attached Google map. The property where the footpath has been closed off is Oaklands, owned by a Mr Gorman. There have been a number of planning issues with this property over the years and there are enforcements in place here, as well as a number of undetermined planning applications. I am not expecting an immediate resolution to this, but wondered what Glos Footpaths position is on this and if there is any action being considered. Yours hopefully. Bob Lewis
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on road near turning to Kim Bailey, 26th February
item.description:
The pothole was filled in a couple of weeks ago but they did not fill it all the way across and it has now opened up even deeper and wider than before
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold

item.title: A listed wall on Blacksmiths Lane at Tudor Cottage has collapsed in part and now bulges with a high risk of falling onto the lane. This presents a risk to vehicles and pedestrians as well as to the integrity of the wall itself which is grade 2 listed., 26th February
item.description:
A listed wall on Blacksmiths Lane at Tudor Cottage has collapsed in part and now bulges with a high risk of falling onto the lane. This presents a risk to vehicles and pedestrians as well as to the integrity of the wall itself which is grade 2 listed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
